text: Our team has incorporated live-reload into our gulp build.  I don't think it's technically "hot reloading," but it works with a chrome extension to automatically reload the page when changes are made. <https://www.npmjs.com/package/gulp-livereload>

Hey <@ULMFQVB8B>! Integrating the new local dev tools with the local HubL server is on our radar, although no definitive timeline on that being complete  <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CLJJXGTC0/p1564763002059500>

Hello everyone. I have a question about `modules` when using local-dev-beta..

Is there a way to add more fields from the `fields.json` from my local env or do I have to go create the new fields in the HubSpot UI and then fetch them down to my local? The part thats holding me up is knowing what to assign the `id` that is associated with each field from my local (if thats even possible)
it is possible to add new fields, although we havenâ€™t made it easy for you on the documentation front.
the `id` property for a field needs to be a unique string across all fields in the module
You can actually leave the id out.
that is true in most cases but not all
When do you need an ID string? When you create a module with local-dev-beta, it omits the id
I have been running into issue where it won't populate my new field without the id key in place
ill try leaving it blank or adding a unique string.
definitely should add a unique string
Thanks everyone for the guidance!!! :raised_hands: :raised_hands: :raised_hands: :raised_hands:
Ok <@U22VBL87M> ill do that. Many thanks
one strategy is to use a dotted path based on the name
making this better and documenting local dev for modules are a top priority :slightly_smiling_face:

I started creating VS Code snippets for things like fields and including modules in templates... it would be neat if HS maintained something like that, or included it as part of the HUBL language extension (which is great btw).
works great! thanks <@U22VBL87M> <@U38EZFVFE>
Oh, actually it looks like maybe fields are already included in the HUBL extension :smiley:
<@UJQNNKKHN> you're correct, snippets are already included: <https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=WilliamSpiro.hubl>
(and are awesome)
